programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey checks out a Colt Army Model 1860 revolver from the Civil War, while Rick sets his sights on a Viking coin and Chum hatches a plan to get a pay rise.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A painted door from the former home of the Doors' Jim Morrison shows up. Corey checks out some rare motorcycles - but can Rick stop him from overspending?.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys haggle over the prices of an antique pistol, a mining certificate issued to Mark Twain and a valuable Spider-Man comic.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The store is divided as Ashley and Seth lay claim to their own individual turfs, while a fake ID puts Les in an awkward situation. Documentary series following the daily running of a pawn shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Matters come to a head when Rich invades Ashley's territory in the jewellery and loan department.

programme.title: Cajun Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Tammie bets Jimmie that she can make a profit from a bar on wheels, and the team checks out a 1930s horse racing game.

programme.title: Cajun Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys go on a road trip, and are offered the chance to buy a 1920s Chevrolet and a note signed by Francis Scott Key, writer of the US national anthem.

programme.title: Stan Lee's Superhumans
programme.desc: The Spider-Man co-creator teams up with Daniel Browning Smith to find people with abilities that would not seem out of place in one of his comics. Here, the duo uncover a man with the power of flight and a healer who can boil hot water with his hands.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: The murder of 32-year-old factory worker North Carolina Jonathan Blackwell. The case went cold until his remains were found in December 2006, and four years following the recovery a man pleaded guilty to the crime.

programme.title: Strippers: Cars for Cash
programme.desc: The teams cross the Channel to search for rusty Citroens in northern France which they can sell for profit at the scrap yard.

programme.title: Engineering Disasters
programme.desc: A look at the causes behind the explosion of a rocket as it was lifting off on its way to the international space station.

programme.title: Engineering Disasters
programme.desc: How a storm took out nine dams in Colorado, flooding entire towns and leaving thousands stranded. Plus, the train carrying hazardous materials that derailed, releasing toxic vapours throughout a small New Jersey community and a cargo jet that crashed seconds after take off in Afghanistan.

programme.title: Engineering Disasters
programme.desc: Two freight train collisions that happened at the same crossing within a year, the collapse of a stage at the Indiana State Fair that left seven concertgoers dead, and an explosion in New York City that leveled two buildings and killed eight people in their homes. Plus, the gaping hole that appeared on an airliner at 36,000 feet, and how engineers in Japan coped with the looming release of radioactive material.

programme.title: Mega Disasters
programme.desc: Documentary using CGI, archive footage and re-enactments to examine how New York City would fare if it were hit by the 130mph winds of a category three hurricane. As one of the world's most densely populated and economically vital cities, the destruction such a storm could cause to the Big Apple would be unprecedented.

programme.title: Mega Disasters
programme.desc: How freak weather conditions in the last few decades are pointing to a rapidly changing climate, raising fresh concerns for the possibility of another ice age.

programme.title: Mega Disasters
programme.desc: Experts create an imaginary scenario where the Californian coast is hit by a 2km asteroid to examine the impact such a disaster might have on the human population. Potential catastrophes brought on by a collision of such magnitude include firestorms, tsunamis and dust clouds.

programme.title: Air Emergency
programme.desc: See just what it’s like to be involved in emergency landings around the world. Plus, leading aviation experts explain how pilots are able to safely land aircraft on land or water… and just what happens when they get it wrong..

programme.title: Air Emergency
programme.desc: Pressure on pilots has never been higher. But a sudden lack of concentration, a miscalculation or a wrong command can end in disaster. We examine the science and see the results of just what can happen when the pilot gets it wrong..

programme.title: Air Emergency
programme.desc: Enter the incredibly complex world of the airport, where the slightest error can result in catastrophe. Plus, visit the world’s most extreme airports, where only the most highly skilled and specially trained pilots are allowed to approach..

programme.title: Air Crash: Disasters Uncovered
programme.desc: Examining the San Bernardino train disaster, when a freight train derailed and crashed into a row of houses in a residential area - before causing the rupture of a gas pipe.

programme.title: Air Crash: Disasters Uncovered
programme.desc: How poor training and a shocking event in the cockpit led to a routine flight from Moscow to Hong Kong falling out of the sky, and resulted in the deaths of everyone onboard.

programme.title: Air Crash: Disasters Uncovered
programme.desc: A look at what happened when a notorious terrorist sets off a bomb on Philippine Airlines Flight 434, leaving one dead and 10 injured.

programme.title: Air Crash: Disasters Uncovered
programme.desc: A look ah how pilots attempted to save 509 passengers when a tail fin blew off a Boeing 747 minutes after take-off from an airport in Tokyo.

programme.title: Air Crash: Disasters Uncovered
programme.desc: Blow Out.

programme.title: Most Extreme Airports
programme.desc: Feature-length documentary highlighting the treacherous conditions at 10 of the world's most dangerous airports. Airline pilots and staff face a constant battle to ensure a smooth and safe operation as they deal with unpredictable weather, tough terrain, high-rise buildings and short runways with sheer drops.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Revisiting the most memorable finds from Storage Wars history, including one alarming discovery that has never been seen before.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: A compilation of some of the biggest mistakes made by bidders in the series' history - as well as previously unseen footage of an explosive argument.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A collection of Playboy Club memorabilia arrives in the shop. Plus, Corey and Chum check out a pair of old Murray bicycles.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Question master Stephen Fry continues the comedy panel quiz's exploration of subjects beginning with the letter L as he asks a range of fiendish questions on the topic of location, with points being awarded as usual for interesting answers as well as correct ones. Irish actress, comedienne and writer Aisling Bea makes her debut appearance on the programme, joining fellow stand-ups Jason Manford and Johnny Vegas and regular panellist Alan Davies, who are all hoping they don't fall into the QI elves' traps and set off the klaxon.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain hosts as regular panellist Hugh Dennis looks back on another events in news and politics, with the help of fellow comedians James Acaster, Angela Barnes, Ed Gamble, Darren Harriott and Zoe Lyons. Yet again, stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on one another.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show in which two teams of celebs try to call each other's bluff with a few stories about themselves that might be true or might be out-and-out porkies. Joining team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are comedians Jo Brand, Roisin Conaty and Paul Foot, and TV wildlife presenter Ray Mears.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts an extended edition of the quiz with a difference, beginning the 'L' series with a range of fiendish questions on the animal kingdom, taking in everything from lonely whales to larval locomotives. Showing off their knowledge of all things natural are comedians Sarah Millican, Ross Noble and Colin Lane, who join regular panellist Alan Davies.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Question master Stephen Fry continues the comedy panel quiz's exploration of subjects beginning with the letter L as he asks a range of fiendish questions on the topic of location, with points being awarded as usual for interesting answers as well as correct ones. Irish actress, comedienne and writer Aisling Bea makes her debut appearance on the programme, joining fellow stand-ups Jason Manford and Johnny Vegas and regular panellist Alan Davies, who are all hoping they don't fall into the QI elves' traps and set off the klaxon.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain hosts as regular panellist Hugh Dennis looks back on another events in news and politics, with the help of fellow comedians James Acaster, Angela Barnes, Ed Gamble, Darren Harriott and Zoe Lyons. Yet again, stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on one another.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Tim Warwood and Adam Gendle travel around the country to complete a variety of outlandish stunts, beginning with an attempt to bounce a man across a lake and into a target.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Brojects
programme.desc: Ingenious brothers Kevin and Andrew Buckles design a deckchair that can be towed at breakneck speeds by a boat.

programme.title: Brojects
programme.desc: Andrew and Kevin Buckles realise their dream of erecting an outdoor film theatre.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz make good on a promise to restore a 1935 Auburn and take the original owners for a ride.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Former boxer Brandon Bernier and his wife Lori take part in a bidding war for a locker full of alcohol.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon Bernier and his wife Lori discover voodoo dolls after buying storage units at auction in New Orleans.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz head west to where the buffalo roam and the skies are not cloudy all day in search of the most perfect picks on the range.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Documentary series following the work of the Staffordshire Police force. Rookie cop Ash is in the thick of it during a late night brawl in Stoke-on-Trent.

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: With the delivery date for the ultimate Vintage Dirt Bike Hauler imminent, Steve pushes his crew and Welder Up's reputation for building the meanest and fastest rods is challenged.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May revisit their bid to build amphibious vehicles, and face one of their toughest challenges yet. The Audi R8 takes to the track and Jools Holland tests his driving ability as the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Officers are called upon to restrain a man having a bad reaction to the 'zombie' drug Black Mamba. Cutting-edge documentary following the work of the Staffordshire Police force.

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: Steve is asked to build a scary villain rat rod in three weeks and a vintage-inspired charity bike for military veterans in just two weeks, but frets when the Vet Bike won't start.

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: James charts the history of 4x4 vehicles from the jeeps of the Second World war onwards, revealing how they rose in popularity in everyday use and in rallies. He explores the rivalry between Land Rover and Land Cruiser, and puts some classic vehicles through their paces by driving up Mount Fuji and through the Mojave desert.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson gets to grips with a Peel P50, the smallest car to go into production, and finds a surprising number of uses for it. James May experiences the luxury of the Rolls-Royce Phantom Drophead Coupe convertible, and the Stig puts the Ferrari 599 GTB Fiorano through its paces on the test track. The Rolling Stones' Ronnie Wood is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, James May and Richard Hammond travel to Africa, where they are challenged to buy a second-hand car costing less than £1,500 and in no way designed to go off-road, and drive across Botswana. Along the way they must negotiate salt pans, rivers and reserves full of animals while facing sweltering heat and suffocating dust.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Question master Stephen Fry continues the comedy panel quiz's exploration of subjects beginning with the letter L as he asks a range of fiendish questions on the topic of location, with points being awarded as usual for interesting answers as well as correct ones. Irish actress, comedienne and writer Aisling Bea makes her debut appearance on the programme, joining fellow stand-ups Jason Manford and Johnny Vegas and regular panellist Alan Davies, who are all hoping they don't fall into the QI elves' traps and set off the klaxon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show in which two teams of celebs try to call each other's bluff with a few stories about themselves that might be true or might be out-and-out porkies. Joining team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are EastEnders star June Brown, comedians Aisling Bea and Seann Walsh, and football presenter Adrian Chiles.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? The Unseen Bits
programme.desc: A compilation of extra material from the comedy panel show, hosted by Rob Brydon. Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by guests including Claudia Winkleman, Miles Jupp, Bob Mortimer, Jo Brand, Adil Ray, Kirsty Wark, Amanda Abbington and Carol Vorderman to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: All Girls Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: A female-only special of the comedy show, showcasing some of the funniest women to have graced the stage at London's Hammersmith Apollo. The programme features Jo Brand, Joan Rivers, Aisling Bea, Kerry Godliman, Nina Conti, Luisa Omielan, Gina Yashere, Angela Barnes, Zoe Lyons, Holly Walsh, Desiree Burch and Tanyalee Davis.

programme.title: Taskmaster: Champion of Champions
programme.desc: Josh Widdicombe, Katherine Ryan, Noel Fielding, Rob Beckett and Bob Mortimer return for more consensual indignity at the hands of Greg Davies and Alex Horne.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Question master Stephen Fry continues the comedy panel quiz's exploration of subjects beginning with the letter L as he asks a range of fiendish questions about literature and language. Stand-up comedian Lloyd Langford joins Bad Education star Jack Whitehall, Only Connect host Victoria Coren Mitchell and regular panellist Alan Davies.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition of the comedy panel game in which question master Stephen Fry continues his exploration of subjects beginning with the letter L, asking a range of fiendish questions about levity, levitation and lights. Comedian and The Last Leg co-host Josh Widdicombe joins The Great British Bake Off presenter Sue Perkins, Room 101 host and stand-up Frank Skinner and regular panellist Alan Davies.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Ffestiniog and Welsh Highland Railway are celebrating their annual Victorian Weekend, while in south Devon, silver service waiter Andy Leech runs the three-course Sunday lunch.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The untold secret story of war production that shaped the Second World War, beginning with how the German aviation industry came to dominate the skies of Europe.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: This edition of the documentary series takes a look at the town of Sodom, which is thought to have existed in ancient Palestine.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the validity of the Bible's best-known stories. Two different theories about Moses' dramatic parting of the Red Sea are examined. The original Hebrew version of the Bible contains references to a 'reed sea' where it is thought the crossing may have occurred.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.sub-title: Tudor Parfitt & The Lost Tribes of Israel
programme.desc: The claims of British historian, writer, broadcaster and adventurer Professor Tudor Parfitt, who says he located an African tribe of Jews called the Lemba whose roots can be traced back to the Jews of the Old Testament.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: Documentary offering an insight into the staff of Moses, one of the more astonishing miracles depicted in the Bible as Moses turned his staff into a snake.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The search for Josef Mengele, one of the most wanted Nazi war criminals, which was led by Holocaust survivor Simon Wiesenthal.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The Jewish group the Avengers who, as the Second World War was ending, hunted down persecutors known to have contributed to deaths during the Holocaust, including Wilhelm Stuckart.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: A look at how British-trained Czechs were behind the assassination of Reinhard Heydrich, one of the main architects of the Holocaust.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: The wildlife of Africa's green belt, an area spanning 5,500km from Uganda in the east to Sierra Leone in the west, which is hotter, brighter and wetter than anywhere else on the continent, allowing plants to flourish. People and animals have learned to exploit this abundance - colobus monkeys have developed specialised bacteria-filled stomachs to neutralise the toxins found in their leafy diet, while the Bakaya and Fang tribes use plant poisons to stun their quarry when hunting.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: Documentary revealing how fresh water acts as a magnet to a variety of creatures on the world's most parched continent. Flocks of flamingos congregate on the inhospitable soda lakes of east Africa, giant crocodiles battle with buffalo on the banks of Zambia's Luangwa river, and cichlid fish use catfish as minders.

programme.title: Wildest Africa
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the wildlife and landscapes of the continent, beginning with the 10,800 square miles of the Okavango Delta in Botswana - the largest inland delta in the world.

programme.title: Wildest Africa
programme.desc: Exploring Victoria Falls, where the Zambezi River creates the largest sheet of falling water in the world.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: The wildlife of Africa's green belt, an area spanning 5,500km from Uganda in the east to Sierra Leone in the west, which is hotter, brighter and wetter than anywhere else on the continent, allowing plants to flourish. People and animals have learned to exploit this abundance - colobus monkeys have developed specialised bacteria-filled stomachs to neutralise the toxins found in their leafy diet, while the Bakaya and Fang tribes use plant poisons to stun their quarry when hunting.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: Documentary revealing how fresh water acts as a magnet to a variety of creatures on the world's most parched continent. Flocks of flamingos congregate on the inhospitable soda lakes of east Africa, giant crocodiles battle with buffalo on the banks of Zambia's Luangwa river, and cichlid fish use catfish as minders.

programme.title: Wildest Africa
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the wildlife and landscapes of the continent, beginning with the 10,800 square miles of the Okavango Delta in Botswana - the largest inland delta in the world.

programme.title: Wildest Africa
programme.desc: Exploring Victoria Falls, where the Zambezi River creates the largest sheet of falling water in the world.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The programme looks at a mysterious group of rusting ships stranded in an arid desert, and a monstrous defensive line on the snow-covered peaks of the Italian Alps.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A closer look at a sprawling Wild West ghost town that sits peaceful and abandoned in Montana, USA, but is still haunted by tales of murder, corruption and buried treasure.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A widow reluctantly parts with her husband's treasured collection of Rolls Royces and Bentleys, and an impulse buyer finds one of the cars a new home.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.sub-title: Kiruna to Narvik - Hitler's Arctic Railway Line
programme.desc: The Nordland Line, the longest in Norway at 453 miles. Stretching between Trondheim and Bodo, it was first built to transport the country's greatest natural resource - iron ore.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: On the Welsh Highland Railway, a newly built Pullman carriage is on its way to Caernarfon Station and a Saddle Tank Loco is being completely restored on the East Lancashire Railway.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Glamorous opera singer Eleanor Samson becomes the prime suspect in a murder case after her estranged husband's lover is found in the burnt-out shell of a boat. Taggart's assistant Peter Livingstone believes Eleanor is guilty, but the grizzled detective's instincts suggest otherwise. Crime drama, guest starring Isla Blair with Mark McManus and Neil Duncan.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: The sisters decide to change the theme of their show, but a flu epidemic puts them behind schedule.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits Barton House in the Cotswolds, where the garden is usually devoid of flowers.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Beatrice recommends Daniel's artistic skills to an attractive client, prompting Evie to question her judgement - and the ensuing argument blinds them to Grace's frustration and the suspicious developments at the Bayswater workshop.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Dave and Donna's relationship is threatened, and Paddy Garvey and Nancy Thorpe make some important decisions. Starring Robson Green and Jerome Flynn.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gina orders Kerry to sever her ties with the Radford family or leave the Met. The Sun Hill sniper claims another victim, raising fears that he's being fed information by a police insider - or may actually work at the station. Behind the scenes, Gabriel gleefully seizes an opportunity to cause renewed friction between Jim and June.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Mickie's midwife mother brings a home birth patient on to the ward, but they find working together difficult. After a gruelling day, Donna doesn't help matters by providing her friend with pills to cheer her up. Carlos makes a shocking discovery about Tricia, while Zubin and Jess try to be just good friends - with little success.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Mike has to talk Josh through an advanced procedure via the telephone, but the patient fails to respond. A baby is brought in overdosed on diazepam and a man attacks the youth who supplied the drugs his late daughter consumed.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: The scales fall from Kerry's eyes when she sees David Radford kissing someone else, and Samantha fears the worst when a girl's body is washed up near where Abi's clothes were found. Adam considers the appalling prospect that the sniper could be one of the Sun Hill team, while Suzie fuels Andrea's jealousy about her closeness to Neil.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Best friends Sharon and Michelle realise they have neglected their friendship of late. They decide it's high time they had a girls' night out.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Will Michelle finally discover the reason why Arthur has been avoiding Mark? Grant lets jealousy rear its ugly head.

programme.title: Sense and Sensibility
programme.desc: Charity Wakefield and Hattie Morahan lead the cast in Andrew Davies's adaptation of Jane Austen's classic novel about a voyage of sexual and romantic discovery. Following the death of her husband, Mrs Dashwood and her daughters are forced to give up their home and move to a small cottage in Devonshire. Elinor is disappointed to leave her old home after falling in love with Edward Ferrars, her sister-in-law's brother, but looks forward to a promised visit. Marianne quickly finds she has an admirer in Colonel Brandon but is swept of her feet by neighbour Willoughby.

programme.title: Sense and Sensibility
programme.desc: Colonel Brandon is called away on urgent business, leaving Marianne free to fall blissfully in love with Willoughby - until he too suddenly leaves for London. Meanwhile, Elinor has a disappointing meeting with Edward, but the reasons for his distant behaviour become clear when Sir John's niece Lucy Steele entrusts her with a shocking secret.

programme.title: Sense and Sensibility
programme.desc: Marianne's health deteriorates as Colonel Brandon reveals the full extent of Willoughby's betrayal. Meanwhile, Edward states his intentions to honour his engagement to Lucy Steele, despite being disinherited by his mother as a result. Charity Wakefield and Dominic Cooper star.

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Christmas special from 1995. The Meldrews' wedding anniversary celebrations turn sour as they learn cousin Ursula has died while watching Noel Edmonds - forcing Victor to defy a witch's grim warning and set out to put her affairs in order.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest finds himself in a seemingly impossible situation when he is told during a confession that Bishop Talbot will be assassinated tomorrow. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: The second of a two-part story picks up where things left off last week, with Humphrey, Florence and Dwayne having swapped the sun and sand of the Caribbean for the cold and noise of London. Their latest investigation has taken them back to the detective inspector's home town - but they've hit a brick wall with the discovery of another dead body. And now they have two murders to solve. Meanwhile, Dwayne has an emotional encounter and Humphrey receives advice from an unexpected source that helps him reach a big decision. Crime drama, starring Kris Marshall, Danny John-Jules and Josephine Jobert, with guest appearances from Ardal O'Hanlon and Sally Bretton.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Sasha is forced to work with her ex-husband Ned Hancock when their teams investigate the death of film critic Oliver Houghton, whose body was discovered floating in the Thames. UCOS delves into the victim's past and explores his link to the murder of a conceptual artist 20 years previously, while Hancock's knowledge of London's hidden past proves invaluable when a piece of occult footage from the 1970s plunges the investigators into the macabre world of human sacrifice. Tamzin Outhwaite and Denis Lawson star, with a guest appearance by Barnaby Kay.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A woman's severed leg is found in the grass at the side of a motorway and Taggart and Livingstone are brought into the investigation. As the body parts build up Taggart finds himself no closer to the solution and the investigation leads them to a butcher who becomes a prime suspect. However, when he turns up dead, killed with the same gun as the dismembered corpse, it appears to be another dead end.

programme.title: Bradley Walsh's Late Night Guest List
programme.desc: The host is joined by some of his celebrity friends who, as well as taking part in games, will help one contestant win their place on the best guest-lists in the world. In the first edition, Bradley is joined by This Morning presenter Holly Willoughby, Baby Spice Emma Bunton and her fiance Jade Jones, and actor Nigel Havers.

programme.title: Take Me Out
programme.sub-title: Take Me Out Emergency Services Special
programme.desc: Paddy McGuinness presents a one-off special of the dating game, hoping to help 30 single women who work in the emergency services find a date on the Isle of Fernandos. Entering the love lift are firefighter John, doctor Iman and paramedic Johnny.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.desc: It's estimated that three quarters of the things now bought in the United Kingdom are now paid for by card - with some businesses refusing to take cash altogether. As more banks and ATMs disappear from the streets, reporter Adnan Sarwar asks if the nation is on its way to becoming a cashless society.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Chart-topping star Olly Murs marks 10 years since graduating from The X Factor as he promotes the new series of The Voice UK. Plus, news, current affairs and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Guest panellists engage in topical debate and celebrity interviews from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a celebrity special of the game show, with Amanda Abbington, Hugh Dennis and Nadia Sawalha all trying to guess well-known phrases for the chance to win a 50,000 pound jackpot for their chosen charity.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five teachers and firefighters answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. Phillip, Alice, Stephen and Jane work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Harriet is nervous ahead of a visit, Moira is confident about her plan, and Liam has a big decision to make.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: As Josh's trial begins, painful memories resurface, and Jade takes Hope to A&E to have her arm looked at. On Steve's behalf, Emma quizzes Amy, wondering why she's so unhappy at home. Ray calls at the garage and is impressed to discover Abi's a mechanic, until he finds out she's also an ex-con.

programme.title: Sean's Scottish New Year
programme.desc: Sean Batty looks at some of the old traditions surrounding New Year, including fire, black bun and dressing the herring. Auld Lang Syne is performed by Dougie MacLean and Mairi Campbell.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: David gets cross-examined in the witness box, and Fiz realises that Hope has been telling more lies. Elsewhere, Steve confronts Tracy with Amy's allegations.

programme.title: Bancroft
programme.desc: Free from the restrictions of her position, Elizabeth is determined to bring the true murderer to some form of justice. Armed with information to solve the case, she heads straight into the heart of the viper's nest. In a disturbing confrontation, she is forced to face her own demons. Crime thriller, starring Sarah Parish, David Avery and Charlotte Hope.

programme.title: Sherlock Holmes: A Game of Shadows (2011)
programme.desc: The detective investigates a series of seemingly unconnected crimes all around the world, and becomes convinced one man is behind them all - the elusive Professor Moriarty. He sets forth on an international journey to bring the evil mastermind to justice, but finds he is dealing with a foe who is his intellectual equal. Detective thriller sequel, starring Robert Downey Jr, Jude Law, Noomi Rapace and Jared Harris.

programme.desc: Al, aided by barman Shaun Williamson and captains Kerry Godliman and Ed Byrne, oversees a clash between The Mayflower from Rotherhithe and The Wheatsheaf and Pigeon from Staines.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A magnesium fire results in a huge explosion, an F-18 fighter jet crashes on an aircraft carrier, and a motorcycle stunt ends in a spectacular crash.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: An F-14 Tomcat explodes over the ocean, wind causes a pair of hydro-boats to crash, and a record-breaking car jump ends with the vehicle splitting in two.

programme.title: American Loggers
programme.desc: A summer of hauling wood leaves the harvesters struggling to keep up with demand. The Pelletiers take on a new business venture building logging trailers.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: Following Geoff and Sharon's wedding, work starts on her GTO and the Overhaulin' crew is called in for a serious refit and a superior surprise.

programme.title: Rocky Mountain Railroad
programme.desc: Following the resilient crews who battle ferocious weather and treacherous terrain to keep Canada's critical freight and passenger trains rolling, serving the nation's isolated mountain communities.

programme.title: Rocky Mountain Railroad
programme.desc: Train crews in the Rockies must haul their 15,000-ton grain train through ice-encrusted tunnels to make their delivery on time.

programme.title: Rocky Mountain Railroad
programme.desc: Canadian Pacific Railway crews transport a huge payload of coal across the Rockies. Plus, a hockey team is stranded in the frozen wilderness.

programme.title: Rocky Mountain Railroad
programme.desc: A spike in the temperature threatens Rocky Mountain's shipments. The team struggles to shore up the track after mudslides and washouts devastate the railway line.

programme.title: Rocky Mountain Railroad
programme.desc: Winter may be over, but spring presents a whole new set of dangers on the Rocky Mountain railroad. Lethal rockslides threaten Canadian Pacific's longest and heaviest train.

programme.title: Rocky Mountain Railroad
programme.desc: Canadian Pacific freight crews tackle one of their most challenging loads to date as the team attempts to haul a 210-tonne reactor on an epic cross country journey.

programme.title: Rocky Mountain Railroad
programme.desc: Springtime in the Rockies sees the repair teams out in force. Veteran conductor Jordy Hunter must dodge the operations in order to make his delivery on time.

programme.title: Rocky Mountain Railroad
programme.desc: To help celebrate Canada's 150th birthday, the Canadian Pacific Railway takes a perfectly restored, vintage train on an epic journey from coast to coast.

programme.title: Treasure Quest: Snake Island
programme.desc: A team of treasure hunters searches an island somewhere off the south eastern coast of Brazil for millions of dollars' worth of Incan gold.

programme.title: Treasure Quest: Snake Island
programme.desc: The team members gear up for their first trip onto Snake Island itself, where they will face scorching heat and one of the world's deadliest vipers.

programme.title: Treasure Quest: Snake Island
programme.desc: Excitement builds when the team make a discovery on the island, but a series of dangerous encounters threaten the mission and people's lives.

programme.title: Treasure Quest: Snake Island
programme.desc: As injuries pile up, the team pushes deeper into the island in search of the Treasure of the Trinity, but a trail of clues leads to confrontation.

programme.title: Treasure Quest: Snake Island
programme.desc: A dangerous run-in leads the team to an astounding new clue, but a communications breakdown leaves them in the dark about an approaching storm.

programme.title: Treasure Quest: Snake Island
programme.desc: The team pushes deeper into the island than ever, tempting fate with every step, and make a discovery that will change their lives.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits a country estate mentioned in the Domesday Book, unearths a cupboard that has been unopened for decades and finds a weathervane dating to 1800

programme.title: The Unexplained Files
programme.sub-title: Are Aliens Attacking Our Nuclear Arsenal?
programme.desc: An examination of what aliens' motives could be following numerous accounts of senior military personnel witnessing UFOs above nuclear weapons bases.

programme.title: Alien Encounters
programme.desc: A war erupts between the quantum computer and the human-controlled computer Queen, and the US military tries to neutralize the hybrid children with electromagnetic pulses.

programme.title: Nostradamus Decoded
programme.desc: Examining the 16th century French apothecary's famously obscure publications, and whether the prophecies hidden within his texts can be believed.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: Documenting the story of Lalit Ram who has learnt to live with a large benign tumour that has disfigured his face.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case in which a couple, recently engaged, were found brutally murdered in a car. Footage from a surveillance camera gave the police their first break.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: A case in which a husband and respected businessman left his home one morning and never returned. Investigators contemplated whether a business deal 'gone sour' was to blame. Plus, a case in which a young mother vanished while searching for work. Officers relied on surveillance cameras to provide them a lead to her whereabouts.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Three cases in which investigators employed forensic science in tracking, apprehending and convicting serial killers.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Investigation into the murder of a mother and her learning disabled son, whose trust fund of $1.7million turned the father into the prime suspect.

programme.title: Animal Cops Detroit
programme.desc: Investigators follow up reports of a starving dog in a Brooklyn basement, but when the animal is released the owner flees.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Two boxer puppies are found wandering the streets, and Dr Chris Brown tries to save one after it is hit by a car and begins to cough up blood.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown and the team hope a miniature horse suffering from dwarfism disease will survive another major operation.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Nik pushes his wife Erendira to choose a sexy gown, while Amy wants the raciest dress possible, and Jaya is hesitant to adhere to her partner's preference.
